TopicTitle: Show off your awesome KSP pictures!

Articles.Content:
SRB separation problem: solved.

Lander engine #4 initialisation problem: solved.

Kerbin orbital tests complete.

Tomorrow, the Mun!

Thanks! They're Ares SRBs from BobCat's American Pack.

New 140 ton Serpent-Class Battlecruiser. My she is a thing of beauty.

<courtesy snip>

Might I suggest uploading your image to an image-sharing site first and linking from there? I'm afraid the forum can't pull images straight from your own computer's hard drive.

Interplanetary Vessel KSS Aurora is finally ready to depart. It took 4 launches and some assembly in orbit. I LOVE those new KAS EVA struts!!

It has a 3m Nuclear Thermal Rocket bringing this baby up to 8000dV, a Utility Bay with a 1-Kerbal Lander, a Science Lab and much more. In case of emergency my Kerbals can use the front Section as Lifeboat.

Docked on the underside is my trusty Kerberos Crew Shuttle (Dragon/Orion Ripoff) in which the Crew arrived.

Novapunch also makes for very good low-tech planes.

After fiddling for maybe 45 minutes, I finally got the warp drive from KSP Interstellar to function on its own, so I took it for a spin:

I went out to Moho, figured that I'd never manage to make orbit, and headed back to Kerbin. A 3 or 4 day mission overall, but it was merely a test flight to see that I had done everything right.

The solution to my problem was very simple, actually; have the warp rings themselves produce the exotic matter they require, instead of relying on the reactors. I went to the config file of the RTG for inspiration, seeing as that little thing produces electricity all the time, and applied it to the warp drive, obviously changing the resource being produced to exotic matter. I also didn't want to have to put up with waste heat, so that just went right of the config files. Et voila! A warp drive that doesn't require too much hassle. Obviously, it's way more OP than the original warp drives that came with the mod, as it doesn't need the reactors and the radiators and what-not, but this is my game. MIIIIINE.

Now to go and combine this with some B9 goodness, methinks.

How low can you go? Wide open throttle with an engine (made by me) that produces 1680 thrust. And yes, Bill survived. I'm not cruel enough to post something like that if I killed one of the big 3. Jeb's in orbit, comfortable in the space station.
